Reviews.Title: “Serves it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: eli0614
Reviews.Content: This is where I stay everytime I fly into Seattle. I usually stay here the day/night I fly in and fly out and then head out into the surrounding areas. It's alway well kept and I have never had any issues.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: MikeV84
Reviews.Content: I disagree with most of the recent reviews. Compared with most other motels from this chain, I found this one pretty decent. We had a large clean room for a modest price. No stains, no smell (a rarity these days...) and everything worked properly. The lobby is indeed not very welcoming (and check-in didn't go smooth at all), but when you go to the cheapest chain, you should expect part of the guests to be similar.

Reviews.Title: “Good for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: Basroe
Reviews.Content: Don't expect too much of this motel. It's a decent place if you need to stay overnight for your departure or after your arrival at the airport. Good matresses, a clean room and everything worked properly, but it's outdated and a little worn out. Not the best Motel 6 you will ever find, but we had a good night sleep (very quiet, no (air)traffic noise) and it's one of the lease expensive places in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest around, and it shows”
Reviews.Author: SEATraveller2
Reviews.Content: If you want cheap, this is it. Stained carpet, front desk clerk behind bullet proof glass, hallway door to outside didn't lock. Bed was comfortable and it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Whitecapsfan
Reviews.Content: At Motel 6, you get what you pay for: decent basic accomodation. There are no frills whatsoever, not even a pen or a clock radiop in the room. Except for a big stain on teh carpet, the room was clean and comfortable. The front desk service was amazing. "Papa" is the best: friendly, personable, helpful and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “well worth the money,Pepper was super”
Reviews.Author: PUPPYPUP
Reviews.Content: what a nice,clean place to stay,and even though it's close to the airport,it was still quite quiet.front staff was nice and friendly(Pepper was great).Beds were tight,and comfortable,water was HOT.Why pay $$$$ when you can stay here,leave your car here and take the bus into the city and save on parking.We enjoyed it here and will stay again if the opportunity presents itself.The nighttime officer was always visable which was very relaxing(catch a few for me).David/Cheryl Sargent 10/1/2010

Reviews.Title: “Clean and dog friendly, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: gooseblind
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Back side of motel was quiet, recently wood chipped. Dog friendly.

Reviews.Title: “just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: kennedyromo
Reviews.Content: checked in quickly, asked about getting back to Safeco field, the lady working kindly told me about the Link-Transit. How to get there & that it had free parking & was very reasonable. We were very thankful, we used it & were impressed. The room was just what we needed for one night. The only problem was that the bed seemed to be a double & not a queen. We will stay again & go see anther ball game.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: grannykay11
Reviews.Content: We found the staff very pleasant and helpful. They even had a listing of the restaurants in the area by type with menus and rates which was a great help. The room was clean .

Reviews.Title: “Decent for an Cheap Airport Motel”
Reviews.Author: nathanwpugh
Reviews.Content: This Motel 6 is about what you would expect for a cheap airport motel. I would recommend it if you just need a place to stay that's close to Sea-Tac Airport. It was only about a five-minute drive to the airport (even with a little traffic). The room was fairly clean, but the building did have a strange smell that seemed to permeate everything. SECURITY: There were definately a few shady characters hanging around that seemed to be long-term residents. However, they do take precautions to make sure that no one too shady hangs around. They require photo identification for ALL parties staying overnight and require information about the vehicle you are driving. In addition, there did appear to be a security guard on the premises at night (or a least a security guard's car). LOCATION: In addition to being close to the airport, there are a few restaurants within a 10-minute walk. It's close to I-5, but pay attention to the directions given. The motel is visible as soon as you exit the interstate at 188th Street, but you have to make a u-turn to get there (and traffic was heavy when I arrived). All-in-all, I would recommend this Motel 6 to anyone needing a simple place to sleep for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient access and good value”
Reviews.Author: BreadBc
Reviews.Content: Stayed over new year's for a cultural event in Granite Falls. I have stayed at this motel many times, and have found it to be clean and affordable. Easy access from I-5 (watch for instructions about U-turn at nearby gas station.) During the day, a very nice area with good roads and good access to almost everywhere. At night, ... hmmm... I personally wouldn't venture too far. I'm a Geocacher, and find this Motel 6 one of the better ones in the Puget Sound area to use as a "base camp". From here, there are literally 1000's of caches within a 50 mile radius.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to exit 152 of freeway I-5; basic amenities useful for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Chelydra
Reviews.Content: The motel comprises several, connected, two-story (ground- and second-floor) buildings with internal corridors. The far back facing away from traffic on S.188th street and I-5 probably has quieter rooms. A pleasant, cooperative receptionist, at our request, assigned to us a room on the upper floor. We stayed one weekday night while on our way south, and it worked out successfully. The double-glazed windows effectively blocked noise from the parking area outside. The motel did not seem completely full, so we cannot say what to expect if all rooms were occupied. It would depend on the behavior of other guests. The gap at the bottom of the door can admit noise from the corridor. The location, very convenient to exit 152 leading to and from I-5, appears popular and to attract a variety of customers. For an extended stay, you might want to consider elsewhere. Also, management should have the outside-access key-card locks at the emergency exits repaired so that they work.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Olraku
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised - this was good value for money. The rooms are fairly spacious, seem to be rather new, that is including the carpet and bathroom. You could detect some stains occassionally if you looked really close, but this is no 4 star hotel. The room was clean. I would recommen trying to ask for rooms in the middle "wing" of the motel - this is the most quiet. The "wing" faicing the interstate gets the noise from the road, but if you turn on the airconditioning, you do not hear the road noise, only the ac. The check-in process is painfully slow if you check-in after 10 pm and there are more people waiting. Overall, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “MMmmmm...”
Reviews.Author: AntonOfOz
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel right near SEA-TAC airport. Low price, but noisy at night from nearby sports bar nightclub, but really convenient location. Rooms spacious but basic. Good if you need short term accommodation near airport.

Reviews.Title: “Sheeeeeeeesh”
Reviews.Author: Craig C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a high school basketball tourney.Check in was fine....... until they lost our reservations.Upon arriving we had to pay $8.00 more than agreed......I was alittle upset but very tired,so I went ahead and payed. About 2:AM the police had to break up a fight in the room across the way from ours.....think I'll stay somewhere else next year............

HotelInfo.Name: Motel 6 Seattle Sea-Tac Airport South
HotelInfo.Address: 18900 47th Ave S, Seattle, WA 98188
